rejection.details:
The Government already needs the approval of Parliament in order to spend public money. We're therefore not sure what you would like to change. 

The EU Referendum Act 2015 requires the Government to provide information to the public on EU membership ahead of the vote. If a new Bill proposes spending public money on something that hasn't previously been authorised by an Act of Parliament, the House of Commons must agree to a "Money Resolution" authorising the new spending.

A Money Resolution for the EU Referendum Bill was agreed to on 9 June 2015.
